top_categories.workout_context: At 100 miles, THE EQUALIZER - Missouri State Championship punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
THE EQUALIZER - Missouri State Championship rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Racing THE EQUALIZER - Missouri State Championship isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.

THE EQUALIZER - Missouri State Championship’s missouri gravel county roads, wine country rolling hills demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at THE EQUALIZER - Missouri State Championship when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of THE EQUALIZER - Missouri State Championship. Make this intensity feel like home.
THE EQUALIZER - Missouri State Championship’s rolling missouri wine country gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what THE EQUALIZER - Missouri State Championship’s rolling missouri wine country gravel delivers on race day.
THE EQUALIZER - Missouri State Championship’s 5,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at THE EQUALIZER - Missouri State Championship — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Every session at THE EQUALIZER - Missouri State Championship intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
At 100 miles, THE EQUALIZER - Missouri State Championship rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for THE EQUALIZER - Missouri State Championship’s 100 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at THE EQUALIZER - Missouri State Championship requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on rolling missouri wine country gravel to build confidence. Expect: missouri gravel county roads, wine country rolling hills, missouri river valley.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, TT Threshold, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 100 miles of rolling missouri wine country gravel in Marthasville, Missouri.
